title: Microsoft Corp. stock underperforms Wednesday when compared to competitors
text:
Shares of Microsoft Corp. 
        MSFT,
        -0.17%
       sank 0.05% to $421.43 Wednesday, on what proved to be an all-around positive trading session for the stock market, with the S&P 500 Index 
        SPX,
        +0.11%
       rising 0.86% to 5,248.49 and the Dow Jones Industrial Average 
        DJIA,
        +0.12%
       rising 1.22% to 39,760.08. This was the stock's fourth consecutive day of losses. Microsoft Corp. closed $9.39 short of its 52-week high ($430.82), which the company achieved on March 21st. The stock underperformed when compared to some of its competitors Wednesday, as Apple Inc. 
        AAPL,
        -1.06%
       rose 2.12% to $173.31, Alphabet Inc. Cl C 
        GOOG,
        +0.21%
       rose 0.16% to $151.94, and Alphabet Inc. Cl A 
        GOOGL,
        +0.04%
       rose 0.13% to $150.87. Trading volume (16.6 M) remained 6.4 million below its 50-day average volume of 23.0 M. Editor's Note: This story was auto-generated by Automated Insights, an automation technology provider, using data from Dow Jones and FactSet.  See our market data terms of use. Something unusual happened in the stock market this quarter: Both the S&P 500 and Cboe Volatility Index, better known as the Vix, rose.
